Package chess

Class Chess

Object
Chess
public class Chess extends Object
The main class of the project handling the process of the game.
Author:
Syed Ali, Mateusz Chojnowski

    main(String[] args)
    Creates a chess board for two players Accepts input from players at their turn through command line Checks the validity of the move through various conditions and shows an error message if the move is illegal game ends when any player resigns by typing 'resign' or offers a draw by typing 'draw?' or through a checkmate All the conditions of a chess game are implemented except stalemate, fifty move rule, threefold repetition and dead position

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      Creates a chess board for two players Accepts input from players at their turn through command line Checks the validity of the move through various conditions and shows an error message if the move is illegal game ends when any player resigns by typing 'resign' or offers a draw by typing 'draw?' or through a checkmate All the conditions of a chess game are implemented except stalemate, fifty move rule, threefold repetition and dead position
      Parameters:
      args -

    • isAttacked

      public static int[][] isAttacked(ChessPiece[][] Board, int rank, int file, String currColor, ArrayList<ChessPiece> Pieces)
      Determines which pieces if any are attacking a particular square.
      Parameters:
      Board - The current board and its piece arrangement.
      rank - The rank of the square requested.
      file - The file of the square requested.
      currColor - The current color that is being potentially threatened.
      Pieces - ArrayList of chess pieces to test on the square.
      Returns:
      result 2D integer matrix containing attackers to square(num attackers=matrix len), storing Rank first then File.

    • CheckMate

      public static boolean CheckMate(ChessPiece[][] Board, int rank, int file, String currColor, ArrayList<ChessPiece> BPieces, ArrayList<ChessPiece> WPieces, int[][] Attackers)
      Checkmate determines whether checkmate is on the board.
      Parameters:
      Board - The current board storing the arrangement of pieces.
      rank - The current rank(e.g.,1,2,3...8) of the King.
      file - The current file(e.g.,a,b,c...h) of the King.
      currColor - The color of the piece that just moved prior to method call.
      BPieces - An ArrayList of the black pieces.
      WPieces - An ArrayList of the white pieces.
      Attackers - A 2d matrix storing indices of pieces attacking the square at the given rank and file.
      Returns:
      checkmate A Boolean value storing data on whether the King is in checkmate. Checks for checkmate in 3 total steps. Step 1: checks for any vacant squares the King may run to. Step 2: Checks if the attacking piece can be taken(if 2 attackers then it is checkmate because you must move King in double check). Finally in step 3 it checks if any piece can safely block a square between the king and the attacking piece.

    • Castlecheck

      public static boolean Castlecheck(ChessPiece[][] Board, int fileDest, int fileStart, int rankStart, ArrayList<ChessPiece> pieces, String type)
      This method checks whether the conditions to castle are met.
      Parameters:
      Board - The current state of the chess board
      fileDest - The file of target square
      fileStart - the file of current square that piece is on
      rankStart - the rank of current square that piece is on
      pieces - Arraylist of current color's chess pieces
      type - current move's color --> white or black
      Returns:
      true if the concerned squares are attacked otherwise false

    • makeFalse

      public static void makeFalse(boolean[] enpassant)
      makes the elements of given array equal to false
      Parameters:
      enpassant - a boolean array

    • enpassantCheck

      public static boolean enpassantCheck(int targetFile, int targetRank, int rank, int file, ChessPiece[][] Board, boolean[] enpassant)
      This method checks the conditions of an enpassant capture and returns a boolean result
      Parameters:
      targetFile - the file of target square
      targetRank - the rank of target square
      rank - the rank of square which is being moved
      file - the file of square which is being moved
      Board - the current state of chess board
      enpassant - an array which specifies the pawns eligible to be captured through enpassant
      Returns:
      true if the targeted pawn moved twice in the previous move and the target square is empty

    • make

      public static ChessPiece[][] make()
      This method sets up the chess board with all the pieces at their default location
      Returns:
      the newly created chessboard
